lead_paragraph: A board ruled in favor of the mayor, saying advocacy groups’ spending would not affect his re-election budget. But it also advised changes to campaign finance law.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Has a Chance to Run a Better Campaign, Not Just a Richer One
headline.main: De Blasio Has a Chance to Run a Better Campaign, Not Just a Richer One

snippet: A board ruled in favor of the mayor, saying advocacy groups’ spending would not affect his re-election budget. But it also advised changes to campaign finance law....
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column discusses troubles that followed Mayor Bill de Blasio after 2014 election, including numerous investigations into campaign practices and pay-for-play relationships of questionable legality; suggests mayor could run better campaign in 2017 by cutting off lobbyists and distancing himself from consultants.
